From: "Gordon Mohr (Internet Archive)" <gojomo@...>
Subject: [ANN] Release 1.4.0
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Heritrix Release 1.4.0 is now available for download:

    http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=73833&package_id=73980

See the release notes for a rundown of changes and important notes, including
a change necessary if you want to use earlier crawl-order files with 1.4.0:

    http://crawler.archive.org/articles/releasenotes.html

In addition to numerous bug fixes and small improvements, some notable
parts of this release are:

  - The BDBFrontier is now the default. Together with other changes
    relying on BerkeleyDB-Java Edition to overflow large structures
    to disk, far larger crawls are now possible within any given
    Java heap size.
  - New experimental features (feedback wanted!):
    - An optional new Scoping/Filtering model based on a series of
      "DecideRules".
    - An AdaptiveRevisitFrontier and supporting classes for scheduled
      revisits of URLs, adjusted by detected change rates. (Contributed
      by Kristinn Sigurï¿½sson of the National Library of Iceland and the
      Nordic Web Archive.)

Thanks for your contributions and bug reports, keep them coming. Happy
crawling!

- The Internet Archive Heritrix Team
